title: WCAS GNDR_ST 372-0-21 Gender, Sexuality, and Performance

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Students in this course will read and analyze some of the most prominent feminist theorists of the 20th century, and apply their analyses to representations of women and/or femininity in performances such as plays, musicals, and dance. We will ask how women perform their gender, and explore the stakes of aligning with gender norms or disrupting them. We will also consider how performances of femininity change over time, and intersect with queerness and race.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be assessed on Canvas reflection posts; a midterm paper; and a final project that will include a presentation and a paper.
